item.title: CVE-2024-50311|2024-10-22T13:24:04.199Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in OpenShift. This flaw allows attackers to exploit the GraphQL batching functionality. The vulnerability arises when multiple queries can be sent within a single request, enabling an attacker to submit a request containing thousands of aliases in one query. This issue causes excessive resource consumption, leading to application unavailability for legitimate users.

item.title: CVE-2024-50312|2024-10-22T13:24:12.165Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A vulnerability was found in GraphQL due to improper access controls on the GraphQL introspection query. This flaw allows unauthorized users to retrieve a comprehensive list of available queries and mutations. Exposure to this flaw increases the attack surface, as it can facilitate the discovery of flaws or errors specific to the application's GraphQL implementation.

item.title: CVE-2024-6508|2024-09-17T08:15:08.940Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: An insufficient entropy vulnerability was found in the Openshift Console. In the authorization code type and implicit grant type, the OAuth2 protocol is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack if the state parameter is used inefficiently. This flaw allows logging into the victim’s current application account using a third-party account without any restrictions.

item.title: CVE-2024-4369|2024-05-29T20:39:40.421Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: An information disclosure flaw was found in OpenShift's internal image registry operator. The AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET can be exposed through an environment variable defined in the pod definition, but is limited to Azure environments. An attacker controlling an account that has high enough permissions to obtain pod information from the openshift-image-registry namespace could use this obtained client secret to perform actions as the registry operator's Azure service account.

item.title: CVE-2024-45496|2024-09-17T15:05:15.692Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenShift. This issue occurs due to the misuse of elevated privileges in the OpenShift Container Platform's build process. During the build initialization step, the git-clone container is run with a privileged security context, allowing unrestricted access to the node. An attacker with developer-level access can provide a crafted .gitconfig file containing commands executed during the cloning process, leading to arbitrary command execution on the worker node. An attacker running code in a privileged container could escalate their permissions on the node running the container.

item.title: CVE-2024-7387|2024-09-17T15:58:45.114Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A flaw was found in openshift/builder. This vulnerability allows command injection via path traversal, where a malicious user can execute arbitrary commands on the OpenShift node running the builder container. When using the “Docker” strategy, executable files inside the privileged build container can be overridden using the `spec.source.secrets.secret.destinationDir` attribute of the `BuildConfig` definition. An attacker running code in a privileged container could escalate their permissions on the node running the container.
